task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 280°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full façade from ground to roofline to estimate height, so I will tilt the camera up while keeping the same heading toward the building.
My heading is now north instead of ~280° toward the target building, so I should rotate back left to face west and keep the upward pitch to gauge total height.
To estimate the building’s full height I need to see the roofline and upper stories clearly, so I’ll tilt up while staying aimed at 280°.
The view has again snapped to 0° while pitched up, so I must rotate to heading ~280° to face the correct building for the height estimate.
I need a stable view of both the base and roof; since pitching up seems to reset heading, I will first move slightly to improve vantage point while keeping the building centered.
